item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Secrets have power. And that power diminishes when they are shared, so they are best kept and kept well. Sharing secrets, real secrets, important ones, with even one other person, will change them. Writing them down is worse, because who can tell how many eyes might see them inscribed on paper, no matter how careful you might be with it. So it's really best to keep your secrets when you have them, for their own good, as well as yours." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Most maidens are perfectly capable of rescuing themselves in my experience, at least the ones worth something, in any case." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "The circus arrives without warning. No announcements precede it. It is simply there, when yesterday it was not." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "The most difficult thing to read is time. Maybe because it changes so many things." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You're in the right place at the right time, and you care enough to do what needs to be done. Sometimes that's enough." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Not everything has to have a point. Some things just are. " -- Judy Blume

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Remember this, Precious Child...nothing matters but the moment. There might be no tomorrow and even if there is, nobody gives a damn." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "Caring too much for objects can destroy you. Only—if you care for a thing enough, it takes on a life of its own, doesn’t it? And isn’t the whole point of things—beautiful things—that they connect you to some larger beauty?" -- Donna Tartt

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "Well—I have to say I personally have never drawn such a sharp line between ‘good’ and ‘bad’ as you. For me: that line is often false. The two are never disconnected. One can’t exist without the other. As long as I am acting out of love, I feel I am doing best I know how. But you—wrapped up in judgment, always regretting the past, cursing yourself, blaming yourself, asking ‘what if,’ ‘what if.’ ‘Life is cruel.’ ‘I wish I had died instead of.’ Well—think about this. What if all your actions and choices, good or bad, make no difference to God? What if the pattern is pre-set? No no—hang on—this is a question worth struggling with. What if our badness and mistakes are the very thing that set our fate and bring us round to good? What if, for some of us, we can’t get there any other way?" -- Donna Tartt

item.title: Kaleigh add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "Sometimes it's about playing a poor hand well." -- Donna Tartt
